channel.title: Recreating a Moog Saw Tooth
channel.description: Hi good people! I just acquired my first Axoloti Core and I'm very excited by the possibilities. Being from a PureData background, I find this think wonderful for the money it costs. Thanks to all the team that created this. Now, for my first project, I'm trying to replicate some sort of Moog Synth. (A Taurus Model 1 really). I did it in the past on a Raspberry PI and it works real good but I'd love to "port" my project to the Axoloti. The Moog sawtooth is a little weird, I atteched to this message a graphic of the sawtooth (Note = C2). Do you have have any suggestions for me? I tried to shift the offset without much success. Thanks in advance for any tips you guys might have, Signed: Marc, the Newbie :slight_smile:

item.title: Recreating a Moog Saw Tooth
item.dc:creator: @Khorus Marc Girard
item.description:
@Khorus wrote:

Wow! That's pretty darn good I say! Thanks, I'll have a serious look at it! Beer's on me!

Read full topic

item.title: Recreating a Moog Saw Tooth
item.dc:creator: @Khorus Marc Girard
item.description:
@Khorus wrote:

Hi good people!

I just acquired my first Axoloti Core and I'm very excited by the possibilities. Being from a PureData background, I find this think wonderful for the money it costs. Thanks to all the team that created this.

Now, for my first project, I'm trying to replicate some sort of Moog Synth. (A Taurus Model 1 really). I did it in the past on a Raspberry PI and it works real good but I'd love to "port" my project to the Axoloti. The Moog sawtooth is a little weird, I atteched to this message a graphic of the sawtooth (Note = C2).

Do you have have any suggestions for me? I tried to shift the offset without much success.

Thanks in advance for any tips you guys might have,

Signed: Marc, the Newbie

image.png1612x833 28.3 KB

Read full topic
